description: For sale in our Atlanta showroom is a sultry 1970 Chevrolet Corvette convertible. This Laguane Gray beauty is quite a find. This '70 Corvette for sale is powered by a 350 cubic inch small block Chevy V8 engine. Built for performance and reliability, this Vette was a car that was no slouch on the streets, to say the least. With a humble rumble coming from dual exhaust, this is the classic late 60s sports car you've been dreaming about. A real classic in anyone's mind, this C3 Corvette for sale is ready for miles upon miles of fun! Backing the Chevy V8 is a 4-speed manual transmission. Easy shifting, this Corvette is a blast to drive, especially when adding in the 4-wheel disc brakes and power steering. The exterior is a sexy shade of Laguane Gray. The fine Metallic hugs every curve and sparkles when hit with sunlight. This exterior is subtle, with just enough "pop" to turn heads. With the top down, this Vette is the epitome of a cool cruising 70s muscle car! Add in the factory style rally wheels, and you have a vehicle that's a complete throwback! Sitting on the inside of the cab, you feel like you've been taken back in time to the late 70s. The Red interior is original style and looks absolutely delicious when matched with the Metallic Gray exterior. Sitting in this 1970 Chevy Corvette convertible for sale is like jumping into a cockpit. The shifter just begs to be grabbed. Options on this 1970 Chevrolet Corvette convertible for sale, include: AM/FM radio, manual convertible top, power steering, power windows, seat belts, and rally wheels wrapped in radial tires. This little C4 Corvette is a fun cruiser and is ready for its next adventure! For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833 or e-mail us at Atlanta@GatewayClassicCars.com.
title: 1970 Chevrolet Corvette

title: 1973 Chevrolet Corvette

description: Numbers-matching, L48/350 motor, 21,510 miles on dash, dark saddle (tan) interior, 4 speed manual transmission, rally wheels, AM/FM/CD radio, X-A/C, headers, dual exhaust, and much more.

We replaced the 4 calipers, master cylinder, brake hoses, brake pads, emergency brake hardware, emergency brake cable, tongue bushing, pinion seal, transmission rear seal, idler arm, sway bar links, and much more. We also changed the oil and filter and rear end grease and additive.
The previous owner replaced the seat covers, carpet, door panels, weatherstrips, and wiper motor.  He also did a basic tune up, and much more over the years he owned it.

1973 marked the end of the chrome bumper corvette era with rear chrome bumpers going away in 1974 and being replaced by rubber bumpers. The 1973 was a one-year-only body design. GM also did away with the vacuum operated wiper door this year, in favor of a longer hood to hide the wipers, and dropped the removable back window in favor of a glue-in window.
http://www.hobbycarcorvettes.net/corvette/1973-dark-red-corvette-stingray-for-sale/

description: This 1973 Chevrolet Corvette 2 Door Coupe
Stock # F13214
is available in our Fairfield, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at

mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Nicely Maintained 1973 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe

New to our Fairfield showroom is this nicely maintained 1973 Chevrolet Corvette 2 Door Coupe with red exterior paint and a black vinyl interior.  It has a 350 cid V-8 engine under the hood with a 4-speed manual transmission, and this nicely cared for sports car is in great condition for a typical daily driver.  With a beautiful body and a like new interior, this muscle car has a lot about it to like for the next owner.
Brand New Interior & Many Recent Upgrades

Additionally, this ’73 Corvette has been with three lifetime owners and with the current owner since 2003.  While it is an older repaint, we have ample receipts showing great service over the past 14 years plus numerous upgrades.  For instance, the interior seating is almost brand new as is many of the interior accessories.  It appears that this C3 has always been nicely cared for throughout its lifetime.

In terms of condition, this 1973 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe is a typical driver with very nice body lines, average paint and a newer interior.  The engine has been rebuilt within the last 24k miles as well, so this one really doesn’t need anything to be enjoyed on the open road immediately.  Also, this muscle car has very good acceleration, typical Corvette handling and everything else you’d look for in a quality example.
Only 24,178 Total Miles on Rebuilt Engine

Overall, this 1973 Chevrolet Corvette is a high-quality driver that is ready to enjoy right away.  Given its conservative asking price and great curb appeal, it would be a great budget-level addition for a performance enthusiast or collector. For more information about this impressive vehicle, visit our Fairfield, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](

).  Be sure to mention

as well.

description: This 1974 Chevrolet Corvette L-82 2 Door Coupe (
Stock # P10298
) is available in our Pleasanton, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at
or by email at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Very Nice Original 1974 Chevy Corvette L-82 Coupe

New to our Pleasanton showroom is this impressive 1974 Chevrolet Corvette L-82 2 Door Coupe with blue exterior paint, a white racing stripe and a black leather interior.  It features its factory 350 cid L82 V-8 engine under the hood with the numbers-matching four speed manual transmission, both of which have been rebuilt within the last 4,800 miles.  From what we can see, this one appears to be a true survivor with very little change over the past four decades.  It is in very nice driver condition as well and it’s priced to find a new home quickly.
Only 4,800 Miles on Rebuilt Factory Drivetrain

The current owner of this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette L-82 Coupe informs us that it’s had three total owners throughout its life.  We do have a good bit of documentation to show that it’s been properly cared for over the years as well, and this beautiful classic still manages to turn heads on the open road today.  There are some cosmetic issues in the paint and the interior so it’s obvious that this example was not a barn find or a classic kept in storage- it has been enjoyed as a daily driver for most of its life.

Additionally, this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette L-82 Coupe comes with the original owner’s manual and other documentation to add to its provenance.  With less than 5k miles on the rebuilt drivetrain, it still performs excellent and it’s ready to enjoy today.
Priced Right to Find a New Home Quickly

Overall, you’ll find that this 1974 Chevrolet Corvette L-82 Coupe is a beautiful survivor that’s seemingly withstood the tests of time in spectacular fashion.  It can be enjoyed immediately or restored back to something truly special, so the next owner is going to have quite a decision on their hands.  For more information about this vehicle, visit our Pleasanton, California showroom, give us a call at

1980 was the last year for no computers in a Corvette. GM produced 5,726 4-speeds Corvettes out of 40,614 total production in 1980.

description: The 1978 Corvettes came in with a bang, being the most extensively redesigned model in a decade. The fastback rear styling was not a hatchback, but allowed for more luggage space behind the seats. The luggage area was significantly larger and included a retractable cover that added security and sun protection. This model year also added a glove box, new armrests, new inner door panels, a redesigned speedometer and tach, and wiper and washer controls were moved back to the instrument panel. This particular Corvette has the L82 engine, a 350 with 220hp, an upgrade to the 350/185hp that was standard. Most of this car is totally original to the car-including the paint. It has 43K actual miles, and must have been kept in the garage, because it is in excellent condition for its age. It drives and handles exceptionally well, and had lots of options that make it a great driving experience. Two-tone silevr exterior Black cloth interior Aluminum wheels Goodyear Eagle ST tires crusie control power steering, brakes and windows Tilt and telescoping steering wheel Solid panel T-tops AM/FM radio with cassette New Calipers, Brakes, Rear Spring, Battery, Rear Spindles and Exhaust. Rebuilt carburetor and distributor.
